page.title: 10LEISURE: Brass Bands
page.content: Cornets, horns, flugels, baritones, euphoniums, trombones, basses and percussion are all needed to make up a successful Brass Band like{Scissett {Youth Band}with whom I play the Tenor Horn. Tenor Horns come with three different finishes: frosted which is dull and looks rather like car bonnets look when the night has been frosty; silver, which is real silver-plating on a brass base; gold which is not really gold but brass. When the tenor horn plays with a band it quite often has the rhythm to play. You have to learn to double and triple-tongue for this. All in all I enjoy my hobby very much and think I will go on playing the horn for nearly, if not all, of my life.
